messages.subject: ok, more on documentation, sorta
messages.msgSnippet: Hi again, All! Thanks for all the suggestions regarding Grace (age 15) and documentation of her stuff. I was able to write up a bunch and use all kinds of
messages.messageBody:
Hi again, All! Thanks for all the suggestions regarding Grace (age 15) and
documentation of her stuff. I was able to write up a bunch and use all kinds of
things from the links and suggestions - made a HUGE difference :) Now,
however...how in the WORLD do I provide her dad (not living with us) with her
work that she has done? He wants, when she comes out, for he to bring the works
she has done during the time not spent with him. He wants to see book reports,
written stuff regarding what she has seen, look at her math problems...ALL
that schooly stuff that Grace HATES and so do I, but makes Todd feel like
Grace is Doing Something. I already have to push her to do the little bit she
does (I SO want full on unschooling, this is SO hard...in fact, I'm going to
post this on another list too, the Unschooling with School one)...I don't want
to School at Home, not in the LEAST! I just feel trapped. So that feeling and
feeling pressure to "make" Grace do written work is getting to me. Any more
wonderful ideas?

Thanks in advance...sorry to constantly be asking basic questions...ya'll
are quite patient with me!

Karen in Southern CA.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
